rooms_list.title: Pavizhamalli
rooms_list.desc: On one side,this suite has views of the river and, on the other, it faces the central courtyard, overlooking a fragrant night- blooming Pavizhamalli tree.

rooms_list.title: Parijatham
rooms_list.desc: Very spacious room adjacent to a “Nadumuttam”, (small traditional inner courtyard), where one can watch the rain in all its fury during the monsoon season.

rooms_list.title: Neelathamara
rooms_list.desc: Overlooking the rear courtyard, this extra-spacious suite has antique wooden flooring and high all-wood ceiling.

rooms_list.title: Neelakurinji
rooms_list.desc: With views of the frangipani and tamarind trees, this large suite next to the rear courtyard, opens to a veranda facing the central courtyard.

rooms_list.title: Ponchempakam
rooms_list.desc: With antique wooden flooring and high all-wood ceiling, this suite opens to a veranda facing the central courtyard, and is adjacent to a traditional wooden swing.

rooms_list.title: Nishagandhi
rooms_list.desc: Exquisite east-facing suite with traditional wooden flooring and high ceiling, its bedroom has Belgian -glass  windows from a bygone era.

rooms_list.title: Sankupushpam
rooms_list.desc: This stand-alone double room with windows on three sides,opens to the rear courtyard, and has its own veranda.

rooms_list.title: Canberra
rooms_list.desc: With a unique decor and ambience, this east-facing room opens to the rear courtyard.

rooms_list.title: Chembarathy
rooms_list.desc: With a 180° view of the rear courtyard and pathway, this bright and airy room  remains cool even in summer.

rooms_list.title: Pichakam
rooms_list.desc: With a 180° view of the landscape, overlooking the central courtyard, this single room is very airy and bright.

rooms_list.title: Ilanji
rooms_list.desc: With its own private enclosed veranda, this single  room opens to the central courtyard.

rooms_list.title: Suryakanthi
rooms_list.desc: Exquisite river-facing suite, with its own private staircase and huge open  veranda, the king size bedroom has a magnificent panoramic view of the lush mangroves and the pristine Anjarakandy river.
